runs.comm: tidy enough start for both teams, dished up fullish on the stumps, Warner flicks around the corner for a single, they thought about two before thinking again
Woakes is lucky to get away with this, it's hideously short and wide and Watson slaps it towards third man who scoots round to field
short ball followed by a half-volley that Watson cracks towards mid-on where a tumbling Pietersen fields well to save
much better this time, Woakes finds the length and line to meet that characteristic clunked forward block from Watson
Woakes is happy to go full in search of swing, there isn't any and Watson drills a straight drive that again Pietersen fields smartly
back of a length this time, Warner tried to work to leg but couldn't. All of which ends a tidy over
Shahzad does find some swing early on and Watson's squeezed drive is fielded superbly by Collingwood, jumping up with to save with one hand at cover
this is a touch close to off stump for the shot but Watson still manages to chop this to third man
nervy times as Watson gets in a tangle with his running. No alarms though. Shahzad was swift there, getting Warner hopping on the back foot and beating him for pace
again Shahzad has Warner in a hurry. Hitting a length around off stump and Warner is slow to get forward
good start this from Shahzad and he finds something approaching the edge here but it's thickish and flies wide of the slips to third man
he's all hustle and bustle but this is a touch wide and Watson crashes his arms through the line, pinging it to cover
Australia are just hitting the field at the moment, Woakes here aims full and Warner cracks it straight to mid-off
first boundary of the day and the ball certainly deserved it. Grisly wide delivery, full as well, Warner just had to throw his arms through the line and the boundary followed
and again! Even better shot this time. On the up and threaded through extra cover
decent recovery from Woakes, reverting to a length and line and it's crisply punched to mid-on for a swiftly-taken single
oops, a few wide ones and now this is fatally full on the pads. Watson only had to help it on its way with a flick of his wrists to collect another boundary
this time it's worked off a middle-stump line to midwicket for another single
straight away Bresnan hits his length and line, just like the Tests, and Watson solidly forward to defend
again Bresnan bangs it down on a length and Watson aims a swish which he can't connect with
wow, Watson has banged this so hard to the cover boundary that he's broken his bat. The handle comes off as he plays the shot - smacking a full wide delivery away
this is again mullered by Watson, on the up as well, but Luke Wright diving at mid-off cuts off the runs
yup, Watson is ticking now, gets a length ball from Bresnan and whips it to the midwicket boundary
low full toss comes off the toe-end and trickles down to long-on. Probably tried to hit it too hard there
good start to the new spell, finds the off-stump channel and Watson steers to point
wonderful hack there from Warner, never looked like hitting it as he swung across the line
Shahzad aims full in search of a yorker and it crunches off the toe-end to mid-on
Pietersen has made a hash of that. He was moved back to a deepish mid-on and Watson duly drove uppishly in his direction but as he set himself the ball sailed over his head and went for four!
firmly driven again this time out to deep cover
Warner tries to give himself room but the delivery is on him too quickly and he can only steer to cover
Bresnan finds a length around leg stump and it thuds off the pads around the corner for a jogged single
full toss from Bresnan and Watson toe-ends to longish mid-on, jogging through for another single
Warner hasn't quite found his range and despite the width here his cut shot is mistimed to cover
good length and line from Bresnan and Warner has nowhere to go
good work from Bresnan, rushing onto Warner from back of a length, it crashes off the body into the off side and a sharp single is taken
ouch! Watson murdered a drive back at Bresnan, who stuck out a boot and found, to his horror, the ball crashing into it
starts excellently, firing it in from wide of the crease and rushing Watson into a defence
width will always cost, but this time just a single as Watson's cut finds deep point
but won't find it here as he has to hurry to defend a slippery delivery
wrong line from Yardy, heading down the leg side and Warner gets to swing it around the corner firmly for four
cripes, that is a very swift quicker ball and Warner again scampers into defence
the line is wrong and it's made a good over bad. Fired down the leg side, comes off a flurry of bat and arms and runs away for four down to fine leg to bring up the fifty stand
welcome Mr Swann. Watson thrusts down a foot and bangs a slog-sweep a long way into the crowds
have that! Swann tossed it up outside off stump, Watson didn't care and repeated the dose. Crashed a long way
three in a row! This is the best of the lot! Again some air from Swann, but not as much as from Watson who swept it a mile into the stands at deep midwicket
fired in this time flat and full, boos ring around the ground as Watson clunks down the ground for a couple
four more this time and Watson has fifty! What an over, what an innings! This is again boshed from outside off stump very firmly for four straight down the ground
full toss, quicker ball again, Watson flicks to square leg
Warner wants a go now but his swinging isn't quite as good and he collects one to deep midwicket
Australia are flying now, this is chopped away past short third man for another boundary. Some class to backup all the muscle
flicked this time to midwicket for a couple more
Watson falls in the fifties again! Gives himself plenty of room very early and Yardy slings down a swift quicker ball that zips off the pitch and crashes into the top of off stump
tossed up by Yardy this time, don't see that too often and Hussey full-faces down the ground for one
good delivery again, full and flat and dug out straight back to Warner
bouncer here, outside off stump and Hussey sways out the way
short again, good delivery. This was sharper and Hussey quickly had to bob under it
short again, pacey too and Hussey had a flap at it outside off without connecting
this time Shahzad goes fuller, not much fuller though and Hussey chops down to third man
after all the short stuff this is the opposite - a low full toss - but Warner can only mistime it down to long-off
excellent yorker to finish a brilliant over. Hussey jabs it back to the bowler who needlessly falls as he collects
Warner hurries back for a second after driving this off his toes to deep mid-on
good quicker ball, slightly shorter too and cramping Warner for room
this time Warner flays cleanly. Down the track and swinging crisply down to the mid-on boundary
Yardy's response is predictable - flat and quick - Warner mistimes an attempted cut
Warner couldn't quite clear the ropes this innings and he's picked out Shahzad on the midwicket boundary as he swung this to leg
this is neither six nor four as instead White shapes the perfect defence back to the bowler
some spin here from outside off, beats the Hussey defence and thuds into pads
this time it's flicked around the corner for a single
White swings a powerful sweep shot down to the square-leg boundary
slightly quicker from Swann and worked to mid-on
steered down the ground for a single. Good comeback over this from Swann
White steers this straight to short third man
starts with a bouncer, sadly for him the line is wrong, too far down the leg side
Woakes very wide of the crease and fires this in full, worked away with the angle to deep square
this time Woakes locates the ideal length and line and White can do nothing but defend
hint of a slower ball here and it's driven without much power down the ground
again there is not much timing, as this comes off the inside edge down the ground for one
an attempted yorker is steered away for a single to midwicket that brings up the Australia 100
good over ends with a mistimed drive down the ground for one
Swann throws this up outside off stump and Hussey flicks back to Swann who fields with a dive
again Hussey steers back to the bowler who scoots across to field
Hussey trying to work Swann into space with a flick of the wrists but he picks out midwicket
this is a touch wide of off and chopped away behind point
Hussey aims big here and his bad timing saves him as it heads one-bounce to deep midwicket
good over ends with nothing but defence
Woakes finds an off-stump line, no great pace though and White cracks it to deep square
Hussey hasn't quite middled this which means he can collect two down to long-off
ugly stroke as Hussey slugs across the line and it heads off the bottom edge down past short fine leg for four
Woakes jumps very wide of the crease to angle this in and it's driven down the ground where Bresnan does well to keep it to two
this fires off the inside edge and heads down to backwards square leg
Woakes has his first international wicket! White departs trying to heave this over long-on, Pietersen jogs in, sets himself and holds an easy catch. Decent effort from Woakes removing a key scalp
fullish ball is driven from well outside off to deep cover
this comes off the inside edge and runs away behind the keeper for one
touch of air from Swann to the newbie and it's worked away for a single into the leg side
ooh, doesn't quite reach the fielder out at long-on, who collects on the bounce
whipped into the leg side for a single. Good stuff from Swann here
worked away for one more to end Swann's spell, which was ruined by Watson's assault in the first over
sharp delivery from Bresnan, hitting a length outside off stump and zipping past the outside edge
Finch is away now properly, skips down the wicket gets a touch of width and creams it wide of point for four
Bresnan corrects his length and line and it's driven very correctly to deep cover
That's gone way, way, way back. Bresnan lands a half-tracker and Hussey threw everything into his pull shot, sending it miles into the stands at midwicket
emphatic response from Bresnan. Perfect yorker rocks the middle pole. Hussey gives himself room, too much room and can't squeeze anything down in time
Smith starts by shuffling across his stumps and it's flicked off the toes towards long-on for a swiftly-taken couple
Yardy is back and starts with a typically quick flat delivery that's worked into the leg side for one
Smith is down the wicket and almost deceived by lack of pace from Yardy, but still works down the ground for one
hint of width here means Finch can chop a cut shot away, but only for one
this hurries through Smith's attempted work-to-leg before he could get a bat on it
this is swatted, with no great timing or power, down to long-on for one
flat-footed hack across the line can only earn a single. Excellent over and an excellent spell
Bresnan starts unspectacularly with a full toss that is shoved down to midwicket for one
this time Bresnan lands the yorker and it's driven hard square of the wicket but straight to deep point
excellent work from Bresnan, full outside off stump, Finch flays and misses
ooh dear, this was an awful shot. Full ball again and Finch had his head in the skies as he tries to slug this into the leg side. The best thing he did was was run a bye
and again it's a play and miss outside off! This is turning into a monster over
fantastic death over ends with another yorker that's just about dug out for a single
not here, as Smith fetches a full wide delivery into the midwicket region for a single
Yardy drops the catch! Chaos! Three fielders were after this as Finch got a leading edge that sailed up towards point, Yardy made good ground but spilled it
cripes. This is indescribably wide. Johnson-like. Full, quick and three miles outside off stump
that's more like it from Shahzad! Full and straight yorker is dug out
this time it's heaved into the leg side, no great power or timing but good running makes it a couple
shot! The cheeky cheery Smith finally shows himself. This is full and straight and quick and it's reverse-flicked for four over third man
Two to finish as Smith slugs it down the ground. Pretty good fielding effort from England to restrict Australia on a good pitch but runs on the board must count for something
